comments.body: can we decrease this to it's minimum value to reduce the time impact on the test suite? Also consider adding a TODO to mock out the time objects so that we don't have to actually wait <interval> seconds (sleeping in tests is generally an antipattern).

I have change the `sleep` to happen after the check which in this case should always fail, this way, the value of the wait time should not be an issue. The mean time should probably be similar to the scheduler heartbeat, i.e. 5sec.Will add the TODO about mocking time objects, but we will still be subject to the scheduler either way.

diffHunk:

            return_value=False,
            poke_interval=5,
            params={'time_jump': timedelta(days=2, seconds=1)},
            dag=self.dag
